intro: Spergularia longipes var. rouyana, commonly known as the coastal sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its prostrate or ascending stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in coastal dunes or disturbed areas. Its leaves are usually linear to ovate, and the flowers are pink or white, with five petals. This variety is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in coastal ecosystems.
